page.title: 04BARNSLEY CHURCH
page.content: Barnsley church is a pretty, small church in a tidy graveyard. There are services there every Sunday, although the vicar is in charge of three different churches Barnsley, Bibury and Winson. The parish is called Bibury. The earliest parts of Barnsley church are Saxon, and you can still see a small Saxon window from the outside. The Normans enlarged the church and it was changed again in the 15th century to look as it does now. The chancel was restored in 1956 in memory of Linda Verey, a member of an important local family and wife of the vicar. There are memorials to several people in the church, with the same names occurring often. Two of them are very interesting because they are the tombs of baby twins who died in 1690.
